scope_summary: Explicitly return 410 Gone for deprecated about/shop URL variants so dead pages are de-indexed and cannot be served by legacy or guessed paths.

legal_and_regulatory.rationale: Route-status cleanup only; no legal policy change.

privacy_local_first_promise.rationale: No new data collection or remote calls were introduced; change only hard-fails deprecated routes.
evidence: No JavaScript storage/network code changed in this patch

medical_scope_and_claims.rationale: No medical language or claims were changed.

behavioral_science_alignment.rationale: Removing dead routes reduces confusion and false affordances for users navigating support content.
evidence: Deprecated paths now return 410 instead of ambiguous missing-page behavior

neurodivergence_research_alignment.rationale: No neurodivergence guidance content changed in this patch.

user_benefit_and_harm_check.rationale: Users and crawlers get a clear signal that these pages are retired, lowering risk of broken journeys.
evidence: netlify.toml includes explicit 410 rules for /about, /about/*, /shop, and /shop/*

brand_voice_and_claims.rationale: No marketing claims changed; this is purely operational route hygiene.
evidence: Only netlify.toml and ship gate metadata were modified

accessibility_and_inclusion.rationale: Clear route retirement avoids users hitting stale pages that fail to provide expected navigation support.
evidence: 410 responses communicate permanent removal and prevent repeated dead-end crawling

security_and_reliability.rationale: Route handling is deterministic and reduces accidental exposure of future placeholder paths.
evidence: Static redirect rules are explicit and force-enabled in netlify.toml

monetization_and_dark_pattern_check.rationale: No payment, pricing, or conversion behavior changed.

ship_decision.conditions: Deploy and monitor crawl reports; submit removal in search consoles if stale URLs persist.
